module.name: Basics
module.description: Learn essential greetings, numbers, colors, and basic phrases to start your Chinese journey.

lessons.title: Essential Chinese Words
lessons.description: Build your foundation with the most important Chinese words including greetings, numbers, and colors.

quiz_questions.question: How do you say 'Hello' in Chinese?
quiz_questions.explanation: '你好' (Nǐ hǎo) literally means 'you good' and is the standard greeting.

quiz_questions.question: What does '谢谢' (Xièxiè) mean?
quiz_questions.explanation: '谢谢' means 'Thank you' in Chinese.

quiz_questions.question: How do you say 'Goodbye' in Chinese?
quiz_questions.explanation: '再见' (Zàijiàn) literally means 'see again'.

quiz_questions.question: What is 'Please' in Chinese?
quiz_questions.explanation: '请' (Qǐng) means 'please' and is used to make polite requests.

quiz_questions.question: How do you say 'Good morning' in Chinese?
quiz_questions.explanation: '早上好' (Zǎoshang hǎo) is the morning greeting.

lessons.title: Basic Chinese Grammar
lessons.description: Learn fundamental grammar concepts: word order, measure words, and basic sentence patterns.

quiz_questions.question: What is the basic word order in Chinese?
quiz_questions.explanation: Chinese uses Subject-Verb-Object (SVO) order, similar to English.

quiz_questions.question: Which word means 'am/is/are' (to be) in Chinese?
quiz_questions.explanation: '是' (Shì) is the verb 'to be' used with nouns.

quiz_questions.question: How do you say 'I am a student' in Chinese?
quiz_questions.explanation: '我是学生' (Wǒ shì xuéshēng) follows the SVO pattern.

quiz_questions.question: What is a measure word (量词) in Chinese?
options: A word used when counting nouns
quiz_questions.explanation: Measure words (like 个, 本, 只) are required between numbers and nouns.

quiz_questions.question: Which is the correct way to say 'one person'?
quiz_questions.explanation: '一个人' uses the measure word 个 between the number and noun.

quiz_questions.question: Chinese verbs:
quiz_questions.explanation: Chinese verbs don't conjugate - they stay the same form.

quiz_questions.question: How do you make a sentence negative with 是?
quiz_questions.explanation: '不是' (bù shì) means 'am not/is not/are not'.

quiz_questions.question: To form a yes/no question in Chinese, you can:
quiz_questions.explanation: Adding '吗' (ma) at the end makes a statement into a yes/no question.

lessons.title: First Conversations
lessons.description: Practice essential phrases for introducing yourself and basic social interactions.

flashcards.back: 你叫什么名字? (Nǐ jiào shénme míngzi?)
很高兴认识你 (Hěn gāoxìng rènshi nǐ)

quiz_questions.question: How do you say 'My name is Li Wei' in Chinese?
quiz_questions.explanation: '我叫〇〇' (Wǒ jiào...) is the standard way to say your name.

quiz_questions.question: What does '你叫什么名字?' mean?
quiz_questions.explanation: '你叫什么名字?' literally asks 'You are called what name?'

quiz_questions.question: How would you respond to '你好吗?' (How are you)?
quiz_questions.explanation: '我很好，谢谢' means 'I'm very well, thank you.'

quiz_questions.question: What does '很高兴认识你' mean?
quiz_questions.explanation: '很高兴认识你' means 'Very happy to know you' = Nice to meet you.

quiz_questions.question: How do you ask 'Where are you from?' in Chinese?
quiz_questions.explanation: '你是哪里人?' asks 'You are where person?' = Where are you from?

lessons.title: Reading Simple Chinese
lessons.description: Practice reading comprehension with simple Chinese texts and characters.

quiz_questions.question: Read: '狗很大。' What is big?
quiz_questions.explanation: '狗' (gǒu) means 'dog'. The sentence says the dog is big.

quiz_questions.question: Read: '玛丽有一只黑猫。' What color is the cat?
quiz_questions.explanation: '黑' (hēi) means 'black'. Mary has a black cat.

quiz_questions.question: Read: '这个房子小，但是很漂亮。' Is the house big or small?
quiz_questions.explanation: '小' (xiǎo) means 'small'. The house is small but pretty.

quiz_questions.question: Read the sign: '出口'. What does it indicate?
quiz_questions.explanation: '出口' (chūkǒu) means 'exit' (out-mouth).

quiz_questions.question: Read: '我吃苹果。' What is the person eating?
quiz_questions.explanation: '苹果' (píngguǒ) means 'apple'. '吃' means 'eat'.

lessons.title: Hearing Chinese Sounds
lessons.description: Train your ear to recognize Chinese tones and pronunciation.

quiz_questions.question: Listen: Which number sounds like 'EE' with a flat high tone?
quiz_questions.explanation: '一' (yī = one) has the first tone (high flat).

quiz_questions.question: How many tones does Mandarin Chinese have?
quiz_questions.explanation: Mandarin has four main tones plus a neutral (light) tone.

quiz_questions.question: The second tone (´) in Chinese sounds like:
quiz_questions.explanation: The second tone rises, like when you say 'Huh?' in English.

quiz_questions.question: Why are tones important in Chinese?
options: They only matter in formal speech
quiz_questions.explanation: Different tones create different words (e.g., mā=mom, má=hemp, mǎ=horse, mà=scold).

quiz_questions.question: Which number '四' has the fourth (falling) tone?
quiz_questions.explanation: '四' (sì = four) has the fourth tone, a sharp falling tone.
